intro: Haplopappus lucidus, commonly known as the shining pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and habitat support.
